error.signature: CUDA error: invalid configuration argument (cudaErrorInvalidConfiguration) - too many threads per block

verdict.summary: Kernel launch requested more threads per block than the GPU supports (typically max 1024). Or block dimensions exceed per-dimension limits (1024 x 1024 x 64). Common when hardcoding block sizes without checking device capabilities.

dead_ends.action: Ignore the error and increase GPU memory allocation
dead_ends.why_fails: Thread limits are hardware-imposed per SM, not related to memory. More memory does not allow more threads per block.

dead_ends.action: Use cudaSetDevice to switch to a different GPU
dead_ends.why_fails: All modern NVIDIA GPUs have the same max threads per block (1024); switching devices will not help

workarounds.action: Reduce block size to 256 or 512 and increase grid size to compensate
workarounds.how: Use dim3 block(256) and dim3 grid((N + 255) / 256) instead of launching with >1024 threads

workarounds.action: Query device properties to set block size dynamically
Use occupancy API to determine optimal block size

leads_to.condition: when reducing block size causes incorrect index calculations

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Too-many-threads is about exceeding per-block thread limits; cooperative-launch-too-large is about cooperative kernel groups exceeding device occupancy
